data.text:
The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has issued the following notice of GPS interference testing that may result in unreliable or unavailable GPS signal:

The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has issued the following notice of GPS interference testing that may result in unreliable or unavailable GPS signal:

Please note that this particular test is not the typical GPS interference test that is centered at a point and impacting an expanding radius with increasing elevation like an upside-down truncated cone. Rather, this test will impact the following area from the surface to UNL (altitudes greater than 99,900FT):

Those needing to contact NC Geodetic Survey for help may do so using the email address below for the fastest response.

Those wishing to donate to the NCGS CORS fund may do so at the link below.

Geodetic news items older than approximately 6 months (unless deemed critical) as well as expired GPS interference testing notices can be found on the news archive page at the link below.
